title: Benjamin ben Isaac of Carcassonne
text: Benjamin ben Isaac of Carcassonne () was a 14th-century <a href="Jews">Jewish</a> scholar. He is known for his translation from <a href="Latin">Latin</a> into <a href="Hebrew%20language">Hebrew</a> of <a href="John%20Mandeville">Jean de Bourgogne</a> of <a href="Li%C3%A9ge">Liége</a>'s work on the corruption of the air by the <a href="Plague%20%28disease%29">plague</a>, under the title of "Ezer elohi, ma'amar be 'ipush ha-avir ve-ha-dever" ('Divine Help: A Treatise on the Corruption of the Air and the Plague', or 1399).
